business.headline: Haven't got your tax refund yet? Here's why it may be delayedSometimes, taxpayers claim deductions like HRA or medical insurance without having proper proof. If the tax department finds something suspicious, they may stop your refund and send you a notice for more details.

India now hosts over half the world's GCCs, led by BengaluruFrom cost-saving outposts to strategic anchors, India's GCC evolution is reshaping global operations. As Tier-2 cities gear up, the next big wave might come from smaller, smarter urban bets.

New income tax bill in Lok Sabha today: How it impacts youThe Bill aims to make clearer rules for exemptions, TDS, TCS, and not-for-profit organisations. All this, the government hopes, will cut down on confusion and save everyone time and trouble.
Karnataka vegetable vendor hit with Rs 29 lakh GST notice. Here's whySelling veggies for four years and accepting UPI has landed Shankargouda with a Rs 29 lakh GST notice on Rs 1.63 crore turnover.

Anthem Biosciences share price: Stock lists at 27% premium on market debutAnthem Biosciences stock price: The company's shares opened at Rs 723.05 on the NSE and Rs 723.10 on the BSE. This was about 27% higher than its issue price of Rs 570.

Burger Singh debunks Rs 47 crore funding claim with viral statementIn a statement that's equal parts denial and stand-up comedy set, the homegrown burger chain responded to reports that it had secured a Rs 47.15 crore investment round, calling the claims premature, misleading, and just plain wrong—at least for now.
Sensex opens flat, Nifty below 25,000; RIL falls 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 130.29 points to 81,627.44, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 48.95 points to 24,919.45 as of 9:22 am.

CoinDCX loses $44 million in cyberattack: Here's what the crypto platform saidThis is the second large-scale hack involving an Indian crypto exchange in the past year. In July 2024, WazirX lost $234 million when one of its wallets hosted on Liminal was compromised.

Anthem Biosciences IPO listing: Shares to make strong market debut? Check GMPAnthem Biosciences share price: The IPO opened for subscription between July 14 and July 16, and was subscribed 67.42 times in total. Highest demand came from qualified institutional buyers (QIBs), who bid 192.80 times the reserved portion.

Standard not met: What Astronomer said on CEO Andy Byron's Coldplay kiss cam rowAstronomer responded to the viral video by placing CEO Andy Byron on leave, later confirming his resignation after stating that leadership standards had not been met. The company emphasised its commitment to accountability and the core values it was founded on.
India's rich are swapping gold for bitcoin. Here's WhyNow-a-days more of India's rich are putting a slice of their gold-backed wealth into shiny new digital coins like Bitcoin.

Astronomer CEO Andy Byron quits after Coldplay kiss cam scandalDataOps firm Astronomer's CEO, Andy Byron, has resigned following a scandal at a Coldplay concert which also involved the firm's HR head, Kristen Cabot. In a statement, the company announced the board of directors had accepted the resignation, stating that "the company's standard wasn't met." The New York-based unicorn company, founded in 2018, confirmed that a search for a new CEO is underway. The resignation followed a board-initiated investigation after an incident at a Coldplay event involving the CEO went viral. The board said that leaders are expected to set the standard in conduct and accountability. There has been no official update regarding any action taken against the HR head, Kristen Cabot, who is the Chief People's Officer at the company.

entertainment.headline: Akshay Kumar confronts fan for filming without permission, later agrees to selfieAkshay Kumar confronted a fan in London for recording him without permission but later calmed down and posed for a selfie. The incident sparked debate online about respecting celebrities' privacy in public spaces.

Vir Das's Fool Volume spotlights Indian crew in global Netflix specialVir Das's Netflix special Fool Volume features 65 Indian freelancers earning first credits. The special challenges western narratives by focusing on Indian creative control and talent.

Drishyam director recalls issuing warning to makers of Ajay Devgn starrerJeethu Joseph, director of the Mohanlal starrer 'Drishyam' movies, recently revealed having to prevent the makers of Ajay Devgn's Hindi version from getting an early start.

Ram Charan bulks up, sweats it out in the gym for Peddi. Viral picRam Charan's transformation for 'Peddi' has set social media abuzz. A new gym photo shared by the actor gives fans a glimpse into the intense prep behind his rugged look, with a crucial schedule of the film starting this week.

Meet two Kashmiri artistes who are behind Saiyaara's soul-stirring music'Saiyaara' gave India a melody to hum, but it also gave us two Kashmiri artistes - Faheem Abdullah and Arslan Nizami. Their Bollywood debut is like a representation of talent and dreams rooted in the mountains, finally finding flight in Mumbai's skies.

Kartik Aaryan's film delayed due to Saiyaara? Anurag Basu breaks silenceKartik Aaryan and Anurag Basu's upcoming musical-drama film release has been postponed to 2026. The delay is reportedly due to the success of Saiyaara and the need to avoid thematic comparisons with it.

Government directs 6 tweaks to Udaipur Files: Nutan Sharma name, AI turban sceneIndia Today has accessed the Ministry's order dated July 21, which accepted the report submitted by the committee on July 19 and instructed the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) and the producer of the film to take necessary action on the proposed changes.

Ajith to reunite with director Adhik Ravichandran after Good Bad Ugly's successDuring a recent press meet, 'Good Bad Ugly' director Adhik Ravchandran confirmed that he will be collaborating with Tamil actor Ajith once again. He said that 'AK64' would be a treat for the fans.

Sonu Sood rescues snake with bare hands, urges public to call expertsSonu Sood calmly rescued a non-venomous snake from his Mumbai society with bare hands. He shared the video on social media and urged people to call experts in such situations.

Rangeen trailer: Viineet Siingh turns gigolo in wild revenge comedyPrime Video released the trailer of its upcoming series 'Rangeen' today. Created by Amardeep Galsin and Amir Rizvi,  the series stars Viineet Kumar Siingh, Rajshri Deshpande, Taaruk Raina, and Sheeba Chaddha.

Veteran actor Tom Troupe, known for Star Trek and Mission Impossible, dies at 97Veteran actor Tom Troupe, renowned for his celebrated career on Broadway and appearances in over 75 television shows, has died due to natural causes.

Vir Das promotes his new show with hilarious Poha twist on New York street. VideoVir Das promoted his Netflix special 'Fool Volume' with a funny video on the streets of New York, where he pretended to be Rajinder Poha, the heir to India's iconic snack. The creative promo left fans in splits and got people talking about Poha and his comedy.

Karan Johar shuts down troll calling him 'nepo kid ka daijaan' for praising SaiyaaraFilmmaker Karan Johar defended his review of 'Saiyaara' against criticism. A troll had labelled him as the nanny of nepo kids in the comment section of his post. The film marks the debut of actors Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda on the big screen.

Rishab Shetty calls Kantara divine force as he wraps up shoot. Glimpse outActor-director Rishab Shetty wrapped up the shooting of 'Kantara - Chapter 1'. The makers unveiled a behind-the-scenes glimpse of the world of Kantara.

Saiyaara box office Day 3: YRF's film beats Kabir Singh for biggest romantic weekendAhaan Panday and Aneet Padda's 'Saiyaara' has emerged as the most loved Bollywood romantic drama in a long time. The tickets are selling like hot cakes and there seems no stopping this YRF biggie at the box office now.

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi... BTS video hints at original cast's return with Smriti IraniThe makers of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' have shared a behind-the-scenes (BTS) video on social media. The video hints at the return of the original cast, along with actor Smriti Irani.  It featured actors Shakti Anand, Ritu Seth, Hiten Tejwani and Gauri Pradhan.

Baahubali team spoofs viral Coldplay couple moment with Prabhas-Anushka's picThe 'Baahubali' team joined the meme fest on Coldplay's viral kiss cam controversy. It featured actors Prabhas and Anushka Shetty as "CEO & HR of Maahishmathi".

Ram Charan celebrates wife Upasana's birthday with grand gesture. See picRam Charan celebrated his entrepreneur-wife Upasana Kamineni's birthday with the cutest gesture. He shared a photo of them, along with their daughter, Klin Kaara.

Coldplay's Chris Martin issues cheeky warning following viral kiss cam incidentAfter the viral kiss cam controversy accidentally outing Astronomer CEO's affair, Coldplay lead singer Chris Martin playfully warned the concert-goers to be camera-ready. His remark came at the band's subsequent performance at Camp Randall Stadium in Madison, Martin.

general news.headline: Bangladesh Air Force jet crashes into Dhaka school, at least one deadThe China-made F-7 jet of the Air Force crashed into the Milestone School and College building in Dhaka's Uttara area.

Border game changer: Strategic 'China-proof' road near LAC to be ready next yearThe new road will reduce the distance from Leh to Daulat Beg Oldie by 79 km and cut down the travel time dramatically from two days to just 11-12 hours.

Will weighted H-1B visa system end lottery-based model? Trump admin has new planThe Trump administration has proposed a weighted selection system for H-1B visas, moving away from the current random lottery model. The change would affect the 85,000 statutorily capped visas and prioritise factors like salary or qualifications. Indians, who make up the majority of H-1B recipients, might be impacted.

Why all 12 convicts of 2006 Mumbai train blasts walked freeNearly 19 years after the train blasts that killed 189, the Bombay High Court has acquitted all 12 convicts, citing torture, unreliable witnesses and botched evidence.
Karnataka vegetable vendor hit with Rs 29 lakh GST notice. Here's whySelling veggies for four years and accepting UPI has landed Shankargouda with a Rs 29 lakh GST notice on Rs 1.63 crore turnover.

Live: Lok Sabha adjourned for third time amid uproar over Op Sindoor discussionParliament's Monsoon session, which opened earlier today, saw heated scenes as the Opposition zeroed in on the government over a string of contentious flashpoints: from US President Trump's claim of brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan, to alleged intelligence lapses in the deadly Pahalgam attack, the Bihar voter list revision, and the Air India crash that killed 260 people.

The government, meanwhile, is poised to push through 17 bills during this session, standing firm against the Congress's renewed demand for restoring Jammu and Kashmir's statehood. This session — the first since Operation Sindoor — is expected to intensify the face-off between the Treasury benches and a resurgent Opposition. When the Lok Sabha convened at 11 am, Opposition members led by the Congress immediately rose to demand a discussion. Speaker Om Birla assured them that all issues could be raised, but only after the Question Hour.

No bias in crash report, western media pushing own narrative: Aviation Minister Live UpdatesRam Mohan Naidu said the probe into the Air India crash was being carried out in a transparent manner and castigated the Western media for trying to promote its own viewpoint.
Faith call in Tamil Nadu: Should temple funds build colleges?An old debate about state control of temples heats up with political rhetoric in the poll-bound state.

Why young Indian couples are putting on the kilosYoung urban Indian couples are increasingly gaining weight together due to lifestyle changes and food app culture. This trend raises concerns about rising obesity and related health complications in newly married couples.
SSVM Institutions: From Cradle to CosmosForging Futures with Foresight, Flair, and Faith

Air India flight from Kochi veers off runway in Mumbai amid heavy rainDespite skidding off Mumbai's main runway amid heavy rain, the Air India Airbus A320 taxied safely to the bay, leaving minor runway damage, officials said.

Rahul Gandhi claims he was gagged as Parliament session kicks off amid chaosBoth Houses of Parliament witnessed heated scenes, adjournments, and walkouts on the first day of the Monsoon Session, as the Opposition demanded a discussion on Operation Sindoor.

Why carrying your own cup could protect your brain, heart, hormonesIf you usually drink tea or coffee from a paper cup, it's a good idea to start using your own cup. Tejaswini AnanthKumar, who leads the Board of Governors at the Indian Institute of Engineering Science and Technology (IIEST), recently shared a post asking people to carry their own cups when they travel.

Nimisha Priya isn't off the hook, but politics of credit has peakedKerala nurse Nimisha Priya's execution in Yemen has been deferred after intervention by Sheikh Abubakr Ahmad Musliyar, the Grand Mufti of India. Her fate, however, remains uncertain. Meanwhile, a battle, political in nature, over the Musliyar hogging credit for the reprieve has erupted in Kerala.

Delhi University cut-offs hit new highs, Hindu College sets highest at 950/1000Delhi University's first UG cut-off list 2025 is out, with Hindu College demanding 950/1000 for Political Science and top colleges setting steep benchmarks above 925, continuing the high-score trend.
Lid blows off excise scam in Jharkhand: What's brewing?Rs 38 crore lost, the scam has exposed a network of forged guarantees, policy manipulation and bureaucratic connivance

Harbhajan Singh recalls Sreesanth's daughter confronting him: You hit my fatherFormer India cricketer Harbhajan Singh recalled his infamous slapgate incident with Sreesanth and how the latter's daughter confronted him for his mistake years later.

Fighting political battles, being misused: ED faces Supreme Court ire in 2 casesThe Supreme Court came down heavily on the ED and issued strong observations on two matters - one involving an appeal against relief granted to Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's wife in the MUDA case, and the other a suo motu hearing on ED summons to lawyers for advice given to clients.

Karnataka sets up SIT in Dharmasthala mass burial case, temple breaks silenceAmid growing national attention, Karnataka formed a Special Investigation Team to probe the Dharmasthala mass burial case. Following the government's decision, the temple has finally issued a formal response, calling for transparency and truth in the process.

Government directs 6 tweaks to Udaipur Files: Nutan Sharma name, AI turban sceneIndia Today has accessed the Ministry's order dated July 21, which accepted the report submitted by the committee on July 19 and instructed the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) and the producer of the film to take necessary action on the proposed changes.

Mysterious signal was heard before a gaping hole popped up in US YellowstoneUsing satellite imagery and data from a monitoring station installed in September 2023, researchers believe the feature gradually formed between late December 2024 and early February 2025.

ChatGPT, crisis of em dash, and please leave our beloved punctuation aloneEm dash is the mightiest punctuation mark — the craftiest would be comma — in the entire English language. It is also now facing extinction because of ChatGPT.

Mumbai roads closed, Andheri subway shut due to heavy rain; more showers expectedWhile the intensity of rainfall reduced in the city by early morning, many parts of the eastern and western suburbs continued to experience heavy showers.
Supreme Court orders CBI probe into 'custodial torture' of J&K constableThe petitioner had alleged that he was brutally tortured and mutilated while in custody at the Kupwara interrogation facility.

Akshay Kumar confronts fan for filming without permission, later agrees to selfieAkshay Kumar confronted a fan in London for recording him without permission but later calmed down and posed for a selfie. The incident sparked debate online about respecting celebrities' privacy in public spaces.

Their Bollywood debut is like a representation of talent and dreams rooted in the mountains, finally finding flight in Mumbai's skies.

sports.headline: Lancashire to honour Farokh Engineer and Clive Lloyd with stands at Old TraffordLegendary West Indies captain Clive Lloyd and former India wicketkeeper batter Farokh Engineer are set to be honoured by Lancashire cricket club with stands named after them at Old Trafford in Manchester.

Freestyle Chess Grand Slam: Aronian wins, Erigasi, Praggnanandhaa finish 6th and 7thIn the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam in Las Vegas, Levon Aronian went on to win the entire tournament and take a cash prize of 200,000 USD.

Jasprit Bumrah targets Wasim Akram's twin Test records in EnglandJasprit Bumrah is on the verge of surpassing Wasim Akram's long-held record of 53 Test wickets in England, adding even more significance to his role in the high-stakes fourth Test starting 23 July.

Mitchell Owen emulates Ponting and Warner's feat after remarkable debut vs WIAustralia batter Mitchell Owen emulated Ricky Ponting and David Warner's feat after his remarkable debut in the first T20I against West Indies in Jamaica.

Mitchell Owen calls dream Australia debut against West Indies really specialMitchell Owen described his dream T20I debut for Australia against the West Indies as "really special" after delivering a match-winning all-round performance in Jamaica.

India to host Chess World Cup 2025 in October-NovemberIndia will host this year's chess World Cup from October 30 to November 27 with a host city for the event to be named in "due course", the sport's global governing body FIDE announced on Monday.

Arteta backs Arsenal's approach on Partey amid sexual assault chargesMikel Arteta highlighted how he backed Arsenal to have followed all the right processes regarding Thomas Partey, who was charged with multiple counts of rape and sexual assault.

Sachin Tendulkar missing from Hashim Amla's list of top 3 greatest battersFormer South Africa captain Hashim Amla surprised fans by leaving out Sachin Tendulkar while naming his three greatest batters of all time. Amla revealed his picks ahead of the India Champions' clash in the World Championship of Legends in England.

With Asia Cup uncertain, Pakistan Cricket Board's revenue could take massive hitWith the future of this year's Asia Cup T20 tournament hanging in the balance, the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) is facing the prospect of a significant financial blow. The tournament, a key event on the regional cricketing calendar, is one of the PCB's major revenue streams, and any disruption could severely impact its bottom line.

Nitish Reddy out of remaining Tests, Anshul Kamboj added to India squadIndia all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy has been ruled out of the remainder of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy and will take no further part in the last two Tests against England.

Who can rescue Indian football? Top contenders to take over as head coachA coach quits, rankings tumble, and club football's on pause—Indian football's in another freefall. The next head coach appointment won't just plug gaps; it could define whether Vision 2047 is dream fuel or dust.

Arteta backs Arsenal's approach on Partey amid sexual assault chargesMikel Arteta highlighted how he backed Arsenal to have followed all the right processes regarding Thomas Partey, who was charged with multiple counts of rape and sexual assault.

Sachin Tendulkar missing from Hashim Amla's list of top 3 greatest battersFormer South Africa captain Hashim Amla surprised fans by leaving out Sachin Tendulkar while naming his three greatest batters of all time. Amla revealed his picks ahead of the India Champions' clash in the World Championship of Legends in England.

The tournament, a key event on the regional cricketing calendar, is one of the PCB's major revenue streams, and any disruption could severely impact its bottom line.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
